segment.source: Choosing Which Version of AGPM to Install
segment.target: Choosing Which Version of AGPM to Install

segment.source: Choosing Which Version of AGPM to Install
segment.target: Choosing Which Version of AGPM to Install

segment.source: Choosing Which Version of AGPM to Install
segment.target: Choosing Which Version of AGPM to Install

segment.source: Each release of Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) supports specific versions of the Windows operating system.
segment.target: Each release of Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) supports specific versions of the Windows operating system.

segment.source: We strongly recommend that you run the AGPM Client and AGPM Server on the same line of operating systems, for example, Windows 8.1 with Windows Server 2012 R2, Windows 8 with Windows Server 2012, and so on.
segment.target: We strongly recommend that you run the AGPM Client and AGPM Server on the same line of operating systems, for example, Windows 8.1 with Windows Server 2012 R2, Windows 8 with Windows Server 2012, and so on.

segment.source: We recommend that you install the AGPM Server on the most recent version of the operating system in the domain.
segment.target: We recommend that you install the AGPM Server on the most recent version of the operating system in the domain.

segment.source: AGPM uses the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC) to back up and restore Group Policy Objects (GPOs).
segment.target: AGPM uses the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC) to back up and restore Group Policy Objects (GPOs).

segment.source: Because newer versions of the GPMC provide additional policy settings that are not available in earlier versions, you can manage more policy settings by using the most recent version of the operating system.
segment.target: Because newer versions of the GPMC provide additional policy settings that are not available in earlier versions, you can manage more policy settings by using the most recent version of the operating system.

segment.source: All versions of AGPM can manage only the policy settings that were introduced in the same version or an earlier version of the operating system on which AGPM is running.
segment.target: All versions of AGPM can manage only the policy settings that were introduced in the same version or an earlier version of the operating system on which AGPM is running.

segment.source: For example, if you install AGPM 4.0 SP2 on Windows Server 2012, you can manage policy settings that were introduced in Windows Server 2012 or earlier, but you cannot manage policy settings that were introduced later, in Windows 8.1 or Windows Server 2012 R2.
segment.target: For example, if you install AGPM 4.0 SP2 on Windows Server 2012, you can manage policy settings that were introduced in Windows Server 2012 or earlier, but you cannot manage policy settings that were introduced later, in Windows 8.1 or Windows Server 2012 R2.

segment.source: If the version of the GPMC on your AGPM Server is older than the version on the computers that administrators use to manage Group Policy, the AGPM Server will be unable to store any policy settings that are not available in the older version of the GPMC.
segment.target: If the version of the GPMC on your AGPM Server is older than the version on the computers that administrators use to manage Group Policy, the AGPM Server will be unable to store any policy settings that are not available in the older version of the GPMC.

segment.source: For information about which policy settings are available with which operating systems, see the Group Policy Settings Reference for Windows and Windows Server.
segment.target: For information about which policy settings are available with which operating systems, see the Group Policy Settings Reference for Windows and Windows Server.

segment.source: AGPM 4.0 SP3
segment.target: AGPM 4.0 SP3

segment.source: If you are using computers that are running Windows 10 to manage GPOs, you must use AGPM 4.0 SP3.
segment.target: If you are using computers that are running Windows 10 to manage GPOs, you must use AGPM 4.0 SP3.

segment.source: You cannot install earlier versions of AGPM on computers that are running the Windows 10 operating system.
segment.target: You cannot install earlier versions of AGPM on computers that are running the Windows 10 operating system.

segment.source: Table 1 lists the operating systems on which you can install AGPM 4.0 SP3, and the policy settings that you can manage by using AGPM 4.0 SP3.
segment.target: Table 1 lists the operating systems on which you can install AGPM 4.0 SP3, and the policy settings that you can manage by using AGPM 4.0 SP3.

segment.source: Table 1: AGPM 4.0 SP3 supported operating systems and policy settings
segment.target: Table 1: AGPM 4.0 SP3 supported operating systems and policy settings

segment.source: AGPM 4.0 SP2
segment.target: AGPM 4.0 SP2

segment.source: If you are using computers that are running Windows Server 2012 R2 or Windows 8.1 to manage GPOs, you must use AGPM 4.0 SP2.
segment.target: If you are using computers that are running Windows Server 2012 R2 or Windows 8.1 to manage GPOs, you must use AGPM 4.0 SP2.

segment.source: You cannot install earlier versions of AGPM on computers that are running those operating systems.
segment.target: You cannot install earlier versions of AGPM on computers that are running those operating systems.

segment.source: How to Get MDOP Technologies
segment.target: How to Get MDOP Technologies

segment.source: AGPM 4.0 SP2 is a part of the Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack (MDOP).
segment.target: AGPM 4.0 SP2 is a part of the Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack (MDOP).

segment.source: MDOP is part of Microsoft Software Assurance.
segment.target: MDOP is part of Microsoft Software Assurance.

segment.source: For more information about Microsoft Software Assurance and acquiring MDOP, see How Do I Get MDOP (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=322049).
segment.target: For more information about Microsoft Software Assurance and acquiring MDOP, see How Do I Get MDOP (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=322049).
